definitions.definition: Relenting ; forbearance to cause or allow harm to another.
examples: She took mercy on him and quit embarrassing him.

definitions.definition: Forgiveness or compassion , especially toward those less fortunate.
examples: Have mercy on the poor and assist them if you can.

definitions.definition: A tendency toward forgiveness, pity , or compassion.
examples: Mercy is one of his many virtues.

definitions.definition: A blessing ; something to be thankful for.
examples: It was a mercy that we were not inside when the roof collapsed

definitions.definition: A children's game in which two players stand opposite with hands grasped and twist each other's arms until one gives in.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) Relenting ; forbearance to cause or allow harm to another.
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) Forgiveness or compassion , especially toward those less fortunate.
( uncountable ) A tendency toward forgiveness, pity , or compassion.
( countable ) Instances of forbearance or forgiveness.
( countable ) A blessing ; something to be thankful for.
( uncountable ) A children's game in which two players stand opposite with hands grasped and twist each other's arms until one gives in.
